{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QThe bins are usually specified as consecutive, non-overlapping intervals of a variable; they must be adjacent and are often of equal size.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QBinning: a form quantization of continuous data, wherein small intervals (bins) of the data are replaced with a value representative of that interval.\\E$"}
{"rule":"PASSIVE_VOICE","sentence":"^\\QOutliers may be plotted as individual points.\\E$"}
